title: LIVE UPDATES: Nor'easter could be biggest East Coast storm in years; at least 2 killed in Pennsylvania pileup
summary:
A nor'easter slammed parts of the Mid-Atlantic states and New England Wednesday, bringing heavy snow, sleet, strong winds and some coastal flooding.
The storm has the potential to be the biggest East Coast storm in years and is likely to bring snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour to the region, according to the National Weather Service (NWS).
Parts of Pennsylvania and New York could see nearly two feet of snowfall, and each state saw massive pileup crashes that left at least two dead and other victims hospitalized.
More than 60 million people are under winter storm advisories in Northeast.
Two people died in a pileup on a Pennsylvania interstate, and a 20-car crash sent at least six people to the hospital in NYC.
paragraphs: A nor'easter slammed parts of the Mid-Atlantic states and New England Wednesday, bringing heavy snow, sleet, strong winds and some coastal flooding.
The storm has the potential to be the biggest East Coast storm in years and is likely to bring snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour to the region, according to the National Weather Service (NWS).
Parts of Pennsylvania and New York could see nearly two feet of snowfall, and each state saw massive pileup crashes that left at least two dead and other victims hospitalized.

"Confidence is high that this major winter storm will result in significant impacts including travel disruptions and power outages across much of the Mid-Atlantic, southeastern New York, and southern New England," the NWS added.
FAST FACTS The heaviest snowfall is expected Wednesday night into early Thursday morning.
More than 60 million people are under winter storm advisories in Northeast.
Two people died in a pileup on a Pennsylvania interstate, and a 20-car crash sent at least six people to the hospital in NYC.
Storm totals could near 2 feet in the Poconos in eastern Pennsylvania and the Catskills in southern New York
According to AccuWeather, the nor'easter was anticipated to bring more snow than all of last year's combined in Washington, D.C., Philadelphia, New York City and Boston.
Follow below for more updates on the storm. Mobile users click here.
